skill.name: pydeseq2
skill.description: Differential gene expression analysis (Python DESeq2). Identify DE genes from bulk RNA-seq counts, Wald tests, FDR correction, volcano/MA plots, for RNA-seq analysis.
skill.summary: Differential gene expression analysis (Python DESeq2). Identify DE genes from bulk RNA-seq counts, W...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate bioinformatics tool for differential gene expression analysis. The skill provides a Python implementation of the DESeq2 algorithm. It reads user-specified CSV files containing count data and metadata, performs statistical analysis, and writes results to user-specified output directories. No network calls, no environment variable access, and no external command execution are present.

content.value_statement: Identify differentially expressed genes from bulk RNA-seq count data with statistical rigor. PyDESeq2 provides complete DESeq2 workflows including normalization, dispersion estimation, Wald testing, FDR correction, and publication-ready visualizations.
actual_capabilities: Perform differential expression analysis on bulk RNA-seq count data
Apply Wald tests with Benjamini-Hochberg FDR correction
Generate volcano plots and MA plots for visualization
Handle single-factor and multi-factor experimental designs
Account for batch effects and continuous covariates
Apply LFC shrinkage for improved effect size estimation
limitations: Requires count data in samples Ã— genes format (non-negative integers)
Needs properly formatted sample metadata with experimental factors
Large datasets require significant memory and compute resources
Designed for bulk RNA-seq only, not suitable for single-cell data

use_cases.title: Analyze treatment vs control
use_cases.description: Compare gene expression between experimental conditions to identify differentially expressed genes for downstream functional analysis.

use_cases.title: Multi-factor designs
use_cases.description: Model complex experiments with batch effects, multiple conditions, or interaction terms for accurate effect estimation.

use_cases.title: Automated pipelines
use_cases.description: Run standardized differential expression workflows from command line with configurable parameters and automated result export.

prompt_templates.title: Basic DEA
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PyDESeq2 to analyze my RNA-seq data. I have counts.csv with gene counts and metadata.csv with sample conditions. Compare treated vs control samples with design ~condition.

prompt_templates.title: Batch correction
prompt_templates.prompt: Run PyDESeq2 analysis controlling for batch effects. My design should be ~batch + condition. Export results sorted by adjusted p-value.

prompt_templates.title: Multiple comparisons
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform pairwise comparisons between multiple treatment groups against a control using PyDESeq2. Generate volcano plots highlighting significant genes.

prompt_templates.title: Custom pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete PyDESeq2 pipeline with custom parameters: minimum count threshold of 15, alpha of 0.01, with Cook's distance filtering. Save significant genes and generate visualization plots.

output_examples.input: Analyze my RNA-seq data comparing disease vs healthy samples

best_practices: Filter low-count genes before analysis to improve statistical power and reduce computation time
Include batch effects in the design formula when technical variation is expected
Use LFC shrinkage only for visualization and ranking, not for statistical significance reporting
anti_patterns: Reporting raw p-values instead of FDR-adjusted values as significant findings
Skipping data validation steps that catch orientation errors or sample mismatches
Applying LFC shrinkage before statistical testing, which can alter p-value distributions

faq.question: What data format does PyDESeq2 require?
faq.answer: Count matrix must be samples Ã— genes with non-negative integers. Metadata must be samples Ã— variables with matching sample names.

faq.question: What is the difference between PyDESeq2 and the original R DESeq2?
faq.answer: PyDESeq2 is a pure Python reimplementation. It aims to match R DESeq2 v1.34.0 default settings while integrating with Python data science tools.

faq.question: Can I analyze single-cell RNA-seq data with this skill?
faq.answer: No. PyDESeq2 is designed for bulk RNA-seq count data. Single-cell analysis requires specialized methods like DESeq2 with special handling or other tools.

faq.question: How do I specify which groups to compare?
faq.answer: Use the contrast parameter: [variable, test_level, reference_level]. For example, ["condition", "treated", "control"] compares treated vs control.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs locally and only accesses files you explicitly specify. No data is sent to external servers or third-party services.

faq.question: What is LFC shrinkage and when should I use it?
faq.answer: LFC shrinkage applies apeGLM estimation to reduce noise in fold change estimates. Use it for visualization and gene ranking, but report unshrunken p-values for significance.
